<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Step-2:-Define-the-return-formulas">Step 2: Define the return formulas<a class="anchor-link" href="#Step-2:-Define-the-return-formulas">¶</a></h2><p>Next, I'll define the formulas for "investment return" (i.e., time-weighted) and "investor return" (i.e., money-weighted).</p>
<p><code>calc_investment_return</code> is straight forward.  <code>calc_investor_return</code> is a bit more involved.  First, flows are normalized to the market capitalization at the beginning of the period (day 0), which we'll use as our base currency.  Then, we will simulate a hypothetical investor who contributes and redeems capital exactly in proportion to the market as a whole.  This hypothetical investor's <code>basis</code> (i.e., cost basis) is calculated.</p>
<p>To simplify the math, I calculate <code>avg_daily_log_ret</code> as the average of daily log returns <em>weighted</em> by capital employed (normalized by capital employed).  In other words, if the example investor started with 100 dollars of capital and contributed 10 each day for the next 10 days, the return they earned on the last day would be much more important than the return earned on the first day, since there would be considerably more capital invested on day 10 than day 1.</p>
<p>The precisely correct way to calculate money-weighted return is to use an IRR formula.  However, solving that formula for a 500, 1000, or 1500 period time series is computationally non-trivial (it requires solving a polynomial of the order 500 or 1000 or 1500...)  I believe this method gives a quite close approximation.  Case in point, if we were to force the <code>df['flow']</code> column to equal zero we get identical returns for investor and investment - exactly as expected.</p>
<p>Note that both calculations are based on the <em>dividend adjusted</em>, <em>net of fees</em> returns so none of the difference between methods is attributable to fund costs or dividends.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">## Time-Weighted Return (aka Investment Return)</span>
<span class="c1"># Calculate average daily log return, annualize assuming 252 day year</span>
<span class="c1"># convert to simple returns</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">calc_investment_return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">avg_daily_ret_log</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log_ret_adj</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span> 
    <span class="n">annual_ret_log</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">avg_daily_ret_log</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">252</span>
    <span class="n">annual_ret_simple</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">annual_ret_log</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">annual_ret_simple</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">calc_investor_return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">''' Calculate the return for the full time period normalized for amount of capital deployed.</span>
<span class="sd">    '''</span>
    <span class="c1"># First, calculate the invested "basis" in terms of day 0 dollars.      </span>
    <span class="n">adj_flows</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">flow</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mkt_cap_adj</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mkt_cap_adj</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span> 
    <span class="n">adj_flows</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span> <span class="c1"># initial principal</span>
    <span class="n">basis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">adj_flows</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cumsum</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="c1">#cumulative contributions in beginning of period dollars</span>

    <span class="c1"># Adjust each day's returns </span>
    <span class="c1">## HERE'S THE MAGIC:</span>
    <span class="n">avg_daily_log_ret</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log_ret_adj</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">basis</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">basis</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">())</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">avg_annual_log_ret</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">avg_daily_log_ret</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">252</span>
    <span class="n">avg_annual_simple_ret</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">avg_annual_log_ret</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span>
    
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">avg_annual_simple_ret</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">compare_annual</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">symbols</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_level_values</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'symbol'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    
    <span class="n">out</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">symbol</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">symbols</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">twr</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'symbol'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">resample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'A'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">calc_investment_return</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">twr</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">name</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'twr'</span>
        <span class="n">mwr</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'symbol'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">resample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'A'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">calc_investor_return</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">mwr</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">name</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'mwr'</span>
        <span class="n">days_in_year</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'symbol'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log_ret_adj</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dropna</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">resample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'A'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">count</span><span class="p">()</span>
        
        <span class="n">both</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">concat</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">twr</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">mwr</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:]</span>

        <span class="n">both</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'symbol'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">symbol</span>
        <span class="n">both</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_index</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'date'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'symbol'</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">both</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'timing_impact'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">both</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mwr</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">both</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">twr</span>
        <span class="n">out</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">concat</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">out</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">both</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">out</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Step-3:-Apply-to-ETF-Data">Step 3: Apply to ETF Data<a class="anchor-link" href="#Step-3:-Apply-to-ETF-Data">¶</a></h2><p>Now that we have the formulas defined, we'll start by applying to various groupings of ETFs - beginning with four major equity index ETFs.  For each, we'll calculate an annualized return for the investment (time-weighted) and annualized reutrn for investors (money-weighted), then difference these two values into the column <code>results['behavior_gap']</code>.</p>
<p>A positive <code>behavior gap</code> means that investors, on average, actually beat the index by being more heavily allocated during upswings than declines.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">symbols</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'SPY'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'IWM'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'QQQ'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'VT'</span><span class="p">]</span>


<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">make_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbols</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">results</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'investment'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'investor'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">symbol</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">symbols</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="c1">#tmp = df.xs(slice('2014-01-01','2016-12-31'),level='date',drop_level=False).xs(symbol,level='symbol',drop_level=True)</span>
    <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">tmp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'symbol'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">drop_level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'investment'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">calc_investment_return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tmp</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'investor'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">calc_investor_return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tmp</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">except</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Failed at: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="n">results</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'behavior_gap'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">investor</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">investment</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_index</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>    investment investor behavior_gap
IWM    15.1263  13.0431     -2.08315
QQQ    21.4864  19.3293     -2.15712
SPY    15.1711  13.5852     -1.58587
VT     11.8944  11.5737    -0.320743
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Here, we see significant behavior gaps for all funds, with possible exception of Vanguard Total World Index (VT).  Taking SPY as an example, the fund's annualized rate of return (net of fees, including dividends) was 15.17%.  However, the aggregate return of investors in SPY was 13.59%, a -1.58% difference!</p>
<p>We can drill into this data by measuring each year's behavior gap.  In other words, the amount that investors, in aggregate, over/underperformed the fund's performance due to timing of inflows and outflows <em>within that year</em>.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># plot by year</span>
<span class="n">by_year</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">compare_annual</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">timing_impact</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unstack</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">by_year</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">by_year</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">year</span>
<span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'"Behavior Gap" By Fund (%)'</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">heatmap</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by_year</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">center</span> <span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.00</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cmap</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">diverging_palette</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">220</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sep</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">21</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="n">annot</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[7]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>Text(0.5,1,'"Behavior Gap" By Fund (%)')</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The negative behavior gap is fairly consistent, even when looking at the impact of flows <em>within</em> a single year. This is, in my opinion, an important validation check which addresses <a href="https://www.kitces.com/blog/does-the-dalbar-study-grossly-overstate-the-behavior-gap-guest-post/">the major criticism</a> of the DALBAR methodology: that it's skewed by long term trends in market returns.</p>
<p>The astute observer will notice that the overall behavior gap is considerably higher than the average of the years.  For instance, SPY has an annualized behavior gap of -1.58% overall but no single year had a gap this wide.  Why? Because the by-year calculations only consider the flow of funds <em>within</em> a given year, not across years.</p>
<p>The one notable exception among this group of equity index ETFs is VT, the Vanguard Total World Stock Index.  Vanguard has the reputation for attracting buy-and-hold types, and the Total World Stock Index may be the most buy-and-hold-y of them all.</p>
<p>Below is a chart of the average absolute daily fund flows (as a percent of fund value) for VT and SPY.  The main takeaway is that Vanguard investors aren't <em>better</em> at timing the market, they're better at <em>not timing the market</em>!</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">vt_daily_flow_abs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'VT'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'symbol'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">flow</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'2011'</span><span class="p">:]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">abs</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'VT'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span>
<span class="n">spy_daily_flow_abs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'SPY'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'symbol'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">flow</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'2011'</span><span class="p">:]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">abs</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'SPY'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span>

<span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Mean Absolute Daily Fund Flows (%)'</span>
<span class="n">vt_daily_flow_abs</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">resample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'BM'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">spy_daily_flow_abs</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">resample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'BM'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<h3 id="Industry-Sector">Industry Sector<a class="anchor-link" href="#Industry-Sector">¶</a></h3><p>With the largest broad-market index funds as a reference, I'm interested in other groupings of funds</p>
<p>It's not uncommon for active investors to "rotate" between sectors based on perceived value or economic cycle.  Here, it appears that investor timing is much more problematic.  Sectors have, on average, a much larger behavior gap of -1.09%.</p>

<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">symbols</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'XLY'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'XLK'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'XLB'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'XLE'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'XLV'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'XLU'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'XLI'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'XLP'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">make_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbols</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">results</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'investment'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'investor'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">symbol</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">symbols</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="c1">#tmp = df.xs(slice('2014-01-01','2016-12-31'),level='date',drop_level=False).xs(symbol,level='symbol',drop_level=True)</span>
    <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">tmp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'symbol'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">drop_level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'investment'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">calc_investment_return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tmp</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'investor'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">calc_investor_return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tmp</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">except</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Failed at: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="n">results</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'behavior_gap'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">investor</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">investment</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_index</span><span class="p">())</span>

<span class="c1"># plot by year</span>
<span class="n">by_year</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">compare_annual</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">timing_impact</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unstack</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">by_year</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">by_year</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">year</span>
<span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'"Behavior Gap" By Fund (%)'</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">heatmap</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by_year</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">center</span> <span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.00</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cmap</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">diverging_palette</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">220</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sep</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">21</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="n">annot</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The behavior gap really intensifies when looking at sector funds, with an average annualized gap of almost 3.4% across funds.</p>
<p>XLE, for instance, shows a behavior gap of more than 5% per year, reaching the ballpark of DALBAR's extraordinary finding.  This effect is entirely driven by year-to-year differences in funds.  As the chart below shows, cash poured into the sector in 2014, just as sector performance tanked.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">symbol</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'XLE'</span>
<span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'symbol'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log_ret_adj</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">resample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'A'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'b'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
<span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">: Yearly Net Flows vs. Yearly Returns'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'symbol'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">flow</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">resample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'A'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cumsum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'g'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">axhline</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.000</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'grey'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">ls</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'--'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Similar to sector funds, country/regional fund investors appear to be gifted for mis-timing markets.  As is often the case, the trade which "feels right", isn't.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">symbols</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'EWA'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'EWG'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'EWJ'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'EWC'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'FXI'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'EEM'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">make_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbols</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">results</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'investment'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'investor'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">symbol</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">symbols</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="c1">#tmp = df.xs(slice('2014-01-01','2016-12-31'),level='date',drop_level=False).xs(symbol,level='symbol',drop_level=True)</span>
    <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">tmp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'symbol'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">drop_level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'investment'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">calc_investment_return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tmp</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'investor'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">calc_investor_return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tmp</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">except</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Failed at: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="n">results</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'behavior_gap'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">investor</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">investment</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_index</span><span class="p">())</span>

<span class="c1"># plot by year</span>
<span class="n">by_year</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">compare_annual</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">timing_impact</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unstack</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">by_year</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">by_year</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">year</span>
<span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'"Behavior Gap" By Fund (%)'</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">heatmap</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by_year</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">center</span> <span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.00</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cmap</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">diverging_palette</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">220</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sep</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">21</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="n">annot</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">

EEM    9.43172  8.33237     -1.09935
EWA    10.7659  8.47475     -2.29117
EWC    8.31316  5.43735      -2.8758
EWG    8.77191  5.78799     -2.98392
EWJ    6.72364  5.19998     -1.52366
FXI    7.77986  5.14926      -2.6306

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Finally, I'll test the major bond ETFs.  Investor behavior strikes again!  TLT (20+ year US treasury) is the notable exception to the rule, with investor returns meaningfully exceeding investment returns.  This is true despite the fact that TLT is among the highest inflow/outflow funds tested (almost 2x the rate of SPY).</p>
<p>Perhaps bond investors truly are the "smart money"!</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">symbols</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'AGG'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'TLT'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'IEF'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'MUB'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'JNK'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'LQD'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">make_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbols</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">results</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'investment'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'investor'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">symbol</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">symbols</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="c1">#tmp = df.xs(slice('2014-01-01','2016-12-31'),level='date',drop_level=False).xs(symbol,level='symbol',drop_level=True)</span>
    <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">tmp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'symbol'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">drop_level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'investment'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">calc_investment_return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tmp</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'investor'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">calc_investor_return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tmp</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">except</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Failed at: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbol</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="n">results</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'behavior_gap'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">investor</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">investment</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_index</span><span class="p">())</span>

<span class="c1"># plot by year</span>
<span class="n">by_year</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">compare_annual</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">timing_impact</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unstack</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">by_year</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">by_year</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">year</span>
<span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'"Behavior Gap" By Fund (%)</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">Within year'</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">heatmap</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by_year</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">center</span> <span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.00</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cmap</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">diverging_palette</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">220</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sep</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">21</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="n">annot</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Summary">Summary<a class="anchor-link" href="#Summary">¶</a></h3><p>I began this post as a counterpoint to DALBAR's shocking results and questionable methodology.  After running the analysis, however, I've found evidence of a shockingly large and consistent behavior gap for ETF investors.</p>
<p>The most basic takeaway of this analysis is "Don't follow the herd".  The popular trade is, more often than not, the wrong trade.  This appears to be true with regard to overall market timing (risk-on, risk-off) and especially true of sector and asset class rotation strategies.</p>
<p>Contrarians can take this as an invitation to time the market, <em>against the flow of market sentiment</em>.  It's  easier said than done to buy an asset class when everyone is certain that it is doomed.  Yet, those who can do this are rewarded.</p>
<p>For those curious about how this signal is playing out in today's marekts, below are the recent (past ~12 weeks) net fund flows for the ETFs used in this post.  Treasury funds (TLT, IEF), along with Consumer Staples (XLP), Municipals (MUB) and China Large Cap (FXI) have all seen significant inflows as of late - a possible warning sign.</p>
<p>Interational equities (EEM, EWJ, EWG, EWA) and materials (XLB) have seen heavy outflows in the past few months, a possible buy signal.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">all_symbols</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'SPY'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'IWM'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'QQQ'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'VT'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'AGG'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'TLT'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'IEF'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'MUB'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
               <span class="s1">'JNK'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'LQD'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'EWA'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'EWG'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'EWJ'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'EWC'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'FXI'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'EEM'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
               <span class="s1">'XLY'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'XLK'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'XLB'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'XLE'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'XLV'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'XLU'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'XLI'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'XLP'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">make_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">all_symbols</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">begin_date</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'2018-06-01'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">end_date</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'2018-08-21'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">colors</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'green'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'grey'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">14</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'red'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">5</span>

<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">flow</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">level</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'symbol'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">()</span>\
<span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">barh</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">colors</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">),</span>\
           <span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Net Flows by Fund</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">2018-06-01 to 2018-08-21'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>

entry.title: Sell in May and Go Away?
entry.summary: There's an old wall street axiom which advises to "sell in May and go away". Has this advice ceased to work in modern markets? Are there other seasonal patterns in the broader market? This analysis evaluates seasonal patterns on the S&P 500 from 1993 to present.
entry.content:

.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */

  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;

 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See

.CodeMirror {

  font-size: 14px;

}
.CodeMirror-scroll {

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;

  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;

  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;

  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);

}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {

}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {

  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {

  }

div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {

}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {

}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;

}

}
input.raw_input:focus {

}

}

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Key-Takeaways">Key Takeaways<a class="anchor-link" href="#Key-Takeaways">¶</a></h2><ul>
<li>The "sell in May and go away" myth has been alive and well for the past 25 years.  Average returns in "winter" months have been more than 2x returns in "summer" months</li>
<li>We also find strong weekly cycles, with Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday producing more than 2x the rate of return (per day) as Thursday and Friday.   </li>
<li>The strongest - and most consistent - cycle is monthly.  Best days are the end/beginning of the month and the 11th through 18th. </li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Introduction">Introduction<a class="anchor-link" href="#Introduction">¶</a></h2><p>Most investors have heard the adage "Sell in May and go away" which reflects the common wisdom that markets perform less well during the summer months than during the winter.  This anomaly is well described <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/news/truth-about-sell-may-and-go-away/">here</a>.</p>
<p>Many widely held beliefs go away, precisely because they're widely held and get priced into the market.  I'd like to test the "sell in May" myth to see how well it has held up.  This is also a great case example to illustrate seasonality analysis - something which I believe gets too little attention because it seems "too simple" to work.</p>
<p>In this post, I'll walk through a simple approach to replicating this anomaly using only end-of-day price data and a bit of python code.  If you'd like to replicate and experiment with the below code, <em>you can download the source notebook for this post by right-clicking on the below button and choosing "save link as"</em></p>
<p><a href="https://github.com/convergenceIM/alpha-scientist/blob/master/content/Sell_in_May.ipynb" style="text-align: center;"><img src="images/button_ipynb-notebook.png" title="download ipynb"/></a></p>
<h2 id="Getting-Started">Getting Started<a class="anchor-link" href="#Getting-Started">¶</a></h2><p>We first need to load returns data.  You'll need to replace this code for your data source of choice, but make sure you use <em>adjusted</em> returns, since unadjusted returns will introduce all sorts of errors related to dividend dates, changes in yield, splits and so forth.</p>
<p>Also, I'm going to use log returns here since they're additive across time.  In other words, the sum of daily log returns is equal to the monthly log return, which is not (quite) true of simple returns.  Since we are mostly using daily returns, you can more or less think of the log returns as simple returns.</p>
<p>Our dataset goes back to the beginning of SPY in 1993</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>

<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="o">%</span><span class="k">matplotlib</span> inline
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">IPython</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">display</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">IPython.core.display</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">Image</span>

<span class="c1">## The below imports interface to my (proprietary)</span>
<span class="c1">## price database.  Replace this code with your own</span>
<span class="c1">## source for downloading price data</span>

<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">sys</span>
<span class="n">sys</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">path</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'/anaconda/'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">config</span>
<span class="n">sys</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">path</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">config</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">REPO_ROOT</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="s1">'data/'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">prices.eod</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">read</span>


<span class="c1">## Load Data</span>
<span class="n">symbols</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'SPY'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">prices</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">read</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_symbols_close</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">symbols</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">adjusted</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">returns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">prices</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pct_change</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">log_ret</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">prices</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">diff</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">spy</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">log_ret</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">SPY</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dropna</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">spy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>date
1993-02-01    0.007087
1993-02-02    0.002116
1993-02-03    0.010515
1993-02-04    0.004175
1993-02-05   -0.000695
Name: SPY, dtype: float64
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Sell-in-May?">Sell in May?<a class="anchor-link" href="#Sell-in-May?">¶</a></h3><p>We'll start analyzing the data by calculating average log returns by calendar month.  Note that, since we're using div/split adjusted prices, these are <em>total</em> returns:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">spy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_frame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'pct_chg'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">by_month</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">resample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'BM'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">by_month</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'month'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">by_month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">month</span>

<span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Avg Log Return (%): by Calendar Month (1993-present)'</span>
<span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by_month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'month'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pct_chg</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span>\
<span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'grey'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">axhline</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.00</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'grey'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'--'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">lw</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Wow, maybe there's some truth to this myth!  It appears that there is a strong difference between the summer months (June to September) and the rest.</p>
<p>From the above chart, it appears than we'd be well advised to sell on June 1st and buy back on September 30th.  However, to follow the commonly used interpretation of selling on May 1st and repurchasing on Oct 31st.  I'll group the data into those two periods and calculate the monthly average:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">by_month</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'season'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">None</span>
<span class="n">by_month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">by_month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">between</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="s1">'season'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'may_oct'</span>
<span class="n">by_month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">~</span><span class="n">by_month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">between</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="s1">'season'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'nov_apr'</span>

<span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by_month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'season'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pct_chg</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span>\
<span class="p">(</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Avg Monthly Log Return (%): </span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">May-Oct vs Nov_Apr (1993-present)'</span>\

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>A significant difference.  The "winter" months are more than double the average return of the summer months.  But has this anomaly been taken out of the market by genius quants and vampire squid?  Let's look at this breakout by year:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">by_month</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'year'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">by_month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">year</span>

<span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Avg Monthly Log Return (%): </span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">May-Oct vs Nov-Apr (1993-present)'</span>
<span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by_month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'year'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'season'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pct_chg</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unstack</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">axhline</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.00</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'grey'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'--'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">lw</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It's a bit noisy, so let's make a four year rolling average):</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Avg Monthly Log Return (%) by Season</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">Four Year Moving Average (1993-present)'</span>
<span class="n">by_month</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'year'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">by_month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">year</span>
<span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by_month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'year'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'season'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pct_chg</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unstack</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rolling</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">axhline</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.00</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'grey'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'--'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">lw</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It appears that the effect hasn't gone away at all!  If anything, it's had a resurgence in the past 10 years.</p>
<p>One theory I've seen floated is that this is predominantly driven by presidential elections - and the market uncertainty thereof.  To test that, I'll group data into election years and non-election years:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">election_years</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'1996'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'2000'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'2004'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'2008'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'2012'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'2016'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">by_month</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'election_year'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span>
<span class="n">by_month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">by_month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">year</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isin</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">election_years</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="s1">'election_year'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span>

<span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Average Monthly Returns (log) for Non-Election Years vs. Election Years'</span>
<span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by_month</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'election_year'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'season'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pct_chg</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span>\
      <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unstack</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">axhline</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.00</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'grey'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'--'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">lw</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Indeed, there does appear to be <em>more</em> truth to the axiom in election years, but it remains significantly valid in off years as well.  Mark Hulbert <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/heres-the-real-story-behind-sell-in-may-and-go-away-2017-04-25">analyzed this theory</a> back to 1897 and sees similar results.</p>
<h3 id="Day-of-Week">Day of Week<a class="anchor-link" href="#Day-of-Week">¶</a></h3><p>Now that we've validated our first pattern, I'd like to test for other calendar patterns.  Let's first look at days of week, looking at the average return by day of week:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">spy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_frame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'pct_chg'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">by_day</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span>
<span class="n">by_day</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'day_of_week'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">by_day</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">weekday</span><span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">1</span>

<span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by_day</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'day_of_week'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pct_chg</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span>\
<span class="p">(</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Avg Daily Log Return (%): by Day of Week (1993-present)'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'grey'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[7]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre><matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot at 0xab31ac8></pre>
</div>
</div>
